tx_oop_Database_Layer::__construct (  )  [private]

Class constructor.

The class constructor is private to avoid multiple instances of the class (singleton).

Returns:
NULL
Exceptions:
tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception If the PDO class is not available

tx_oop_Database_Layer::__destruct (  ) 

Class destructor.

This method will close the PDO connection to the TYPO3 database.

Returns:
NULL

Member Function Documentation

tx_oop_Database_Layer::__call ( $  name,
array $  args = array() 
)

PHP method calls overloading.

This method will reroute all the call on this object to the PDO object.

Parameters:
string The name of the called method
array The arguments for the called method
Returns:
mixed The result of the PDO method called
Exceptions:
tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception If the called method does not exist

Definition at line 197 of file Layer.class.php.

tx_oop_Database_Layer::__clone (  ) 

Clones an instance of the class.

A call to this method will produce an exception, as the class cannot be cloned (singleton).

Returns:
NULL
Exceptions:
tx_oop_Core_Singleton_Exception Always, as the class cannot be cloned (singleton)

static tx_oop_Database_Layer::getInstance (  )  [static]

Gets the unique class instance.

This method is used to get the unique instance of the class (singleton). If no instance is available, it will create it.

Returns:
tx_oop_Database_Layer The unique instance of the class
